title: World’s happiest country is grappling with rising unemployment and economic stagnation
description:
Unemployment stands at nearly 10%, one of the highest rates in the European Union.

Harsh economic headwinds are weighing heavily on the world’s happiest nation. Finland is confronting economic stagnation, rising unemployment, and growing pressure on public finances, yet it has still secured the tit...

title: Finland's economy is stagnating, European Commision says
description:
Finland's public debt is projected to accelerate from 82.5 percent of GDP in 2024 to 92.3 percent by 2027, reflecting one of the fastest debt growth trajectories in the EU.

Finland could rank as the sixth most indebted country in the EU by 2027, according to the Commission.

Finland's economy is ex...

title: Finland, the land of happy people: optimism and economic crisis
description:
Finland is struggling with economic stagnation, rising unemployment and weak public finances, but it has still managed to retain the title of the world’s happiest country for many years in a row, writes Reuters.

Experts say that generous welfare policies are largely responsible for this success. Ho...

title: Cheap Fashion Hits Finland
description:
By Farah Mokrani • Published: 30 Nov 2025 • 18:15 • 3 minutes read

Fast-fashion giants Temu and Shein face criticism as cheap clothing floods Finland’s recycling centres. Credit : Paulm1993, Shutterstock

title: Finland must accelerate efforts towards a circular economy of plastics
Finland Govt backs Neometals' vanadium tech with A$87M grant
description: ASX listed has welcomed the backing of the Government of Finland which will contribute a €48.7M (A$86.8M) grant towards the building of a vanadium recycling plant in the Finish port of Pori. The plant will recycle vanadium industrial waste streams using technology developed by which owns 86% of the ...

title: European countries at risk of going bankrupt under EU spending rules
description:
Finland could be recommended spending cuts due to its deficit

title: Finland's economy contracts 0.3 pct in Q3 as unemployment rises
description:
HELSINKI, Nov. 28 (Xinhua) -- Finland's economy contracted by 0.3 percent in the third quarter of 2025 from the previous quarter and by 0.6 percent year-on-year, Statistics Finland said Friday.

By contrast, the European Union's gross domestic product (GDP) grew by 0.3 percent quarter-on-quarter, pr...

title: Finland heads in the opposite direction from rest of EU as GDP slips
description:
Exports perked up slightly in the 3rd quarter (file photo of Helsinki's Vuosaari port).

While GDP declined slightly between July and September, there were other signs that the economy may be gradually perking up.

Finland's gross domestic product (GDP) shrank slightly in the third quarter of this y...

title: EU Commission to discipline Finland over excessive state debt
description:
Last week, Finance Minister Riikka Purra (Finns) warned parliament members that Finland would likely be subject to the Excessive Debt Procedure.

The European Commission proposed on Tuesday to begin taking disciplinary steps against Finland over its excessive state deficit.

The disciplinary process...

title: Finland's unemployment rate at highest since 2009 — 10.3%
description:
In a report about Finland's jobless situation, news agency Reuters met with 33-year-old Juho-Pekka Palomaa, who was marking his 1,000th day of unemployment.

The trending unemployment rate stood at 10.3 percent in October, a proportion reflecting around 276,000 jobless people.

title: Union boss accuses government of pushing people into "poverty, unemployment and despair"
description:
The head of Finland's largest union federation has criticised the government's economic and employment policies, while the Chamber of Commerce has called into question its attitude towards immigrants.
